newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: NZ wool prices firm at Christchurch sale.
newsitem.headline: NZ wool prices firm at Christchurch sale.

text.p: New Zealand wool prices generally edged back up at Thursday's Christchurch sale, the market indicator rising 10 cents to 425 cents after a 20 cent drop at Napier a week ago, Wools of New Zealand said.
The strong segment indicator rose 6 cents to 360 cents, and the lamb indicator edged up one cent to 396.

Of the 2,588 clean tonnes on offer, 29 percent was crossbred fleece, 25 percent was second shear, 16 percent lambswool, 11 percent second shear, bellies and pieces and seven percent halfbred fleece, with the balance miscellaneous wools.
Some 22 percent of the offer was passed in.
